resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
kou commented on pull request #5901: ARROW-7260: [CI] Fix Ubuntu 14.04 test job
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5901
 
 
   https://circleci.com/gh/ursa-labs/crossbow/5329
   
     /arrow/cpp/src/arrow/dataset/filter_test.cc:80:194: error: invalid suffix on literal; C++11 requires a space between literal and identifier [-Werror=literal-suffix]
        ASSERT_EQ("a"_.ToString(), "a");
                     ^
   
   g++ on Ubuntu 14.04 supports user defined literal but we can't use
   user defined literal with ccache + g++ on Ubuntu 14.04.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5901#issuecomment-558552494

   (also, we could simply drop 14.04 as suggested on the ML)

kou commented on issue #5901: ARROW-7260: [CI] Fix Ubuntu 14.04 test job
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5901#issuecomment-558666569
 
 
   The error has gone but there are still another errors:
   
   ```text
   /arrow/cpp/src/arrow/dataset/filter_test.cc:80:196: error: expected ')' before 'a'
      ASSERT_EQ("a"_.ToString(), "a");
                                                                                                                                                                                                       ^
   ```
   
   BTW, why do you want to use ccache here? We disable reusing ccache cache over containers for now: https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/ci/scripts/cpp_build.sh#L37
   
   So we can't improve build performance by ccache for now.
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on issue #5901: ARROW-7260: [CI] Fix Ubuntu 14.04 test job
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5901#issuecomment-558674856
 
 
   It seems that g++ 4.8 doesn't support `[^...]` regular expression.
   
   It seems that g++ 4.9 or later is required: https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=53631 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
